dialogs.text: Hello. I'm a little busy. Are you here for something?

choices.text: Did you take your roommate's pencil?

dialogs.text: Oh. That. Wait, before you say anything, my song just ended. Are you ok with listening to music?

choices.text: Yeah, I listen to music all the time.
Yeah, I'm ok with you playing music.

dialogs.text: What are you talking about?
RevealResults15 Oops, I think they meant to ask for permission. Human languages sure are confusing.
Good. I'll find you some good songs.
RevealResults15 Yay, I think you interpreted that correctly! Human languages sure are confusing.
You can pick the next one.

choices.text: It's your music, you choose.
Let's hear my options.

dialogs.text: Sure, I can't complain about that. I was just trying to help the guest get comfortable.
NewSong00 This is the first one.
NewSong01 This is the second one.
NewSong02 And this is the third one.
Which one are you feeling, dear guest?

choices.text: Song one.
Song two.
Song three.
Can I hear them again?

dialogs.text: NewSong00 <size=80%>Ah, I love this one. Now, plead your case. I'm still using this pencil, you know.

choices.text: You'd make your roommate really happy if you returned that pencil! I'm sure she'd appreciate it to no end.
That was really unfair of you to just take your roommate's pencil without asking. She's probably mad. You should seriously return it now.
That pencil is super important to your roommate. You're making her really depressed by not giving it back.</size>

dialogs.text: Let me think about it. ... Nah. I'm not feeling it.
RevealResults06 It looks like we could really use that music to boost our message.
Let me think about it. ... Nah. I'm not feeling it.
...Yeah. I get where you're coming from.
RevealResults00 Wow, that music made an effect! And it sounds like you understand the moods and tunes well enough.
RevealResults06 Good thing you chose a song, too. Music is a powerful force, huh?
I'm not done with you yet. That pink-haired friend of yours is also a good friend of mine. They were with me when I took that pencil. Did they tell you I had it?

choices.text: They told me the cafeteria server took it.

dialogs.text: RevealResults24 They must have lied to protect their friend from blame, even if it meant the pencil wouldn't get returned. I can't say I agree with that, but it's awfully sweet.
Well. I suppose I should thank them for trying to help me, but for now, take the pencil back. I'll find a new one later. I want to finish this song.
